snippet: Archaeologists have figured out the composition of a beverage called black drink, consumed a millennium ago by people in what is now Illinois.
abstract: Dr Patricia L Crown study in journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences describes evidence that pre-Columbian people consumed a caffeinated tealike beverage as early as AD 1050.
lead_paragraph: Archaeologists have figured out the composition of a beverage called black drink, consumed a millennium ago by people in what is now Illinois.

headline.seo: Ancient Caffeinated ‘Black Drink’ Was Made With Holly, Analysis Finds
headline.main: Ancient Energy Boost, Brewed From Toasted Leaves and Bark
headline.print_headline: Ancient Energy Boost, Brewed From Toasted Leaves and Bark

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
